gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.gnuplot
Class GnuPlotWriter

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.gnuplot.GnuPlotWriter

public class GnuPlotWriter
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class that prints files which command gnuplot to generate 1D or 2D diagrams (diagrams which depict the values of a measurement with regards to one or two variables that affect it).

Author:
andreou

Nested Class Summary
static class GnuPlotWriter.GnuPlotFiles
          A container of generated gnuplot files.
 
Constructor Summary
GnuPlotWriter(java.io.File rootFolder)
          Creates a GnuPlotWriter, that will create in the specified folder, subfolders "data", "plt", "eps", which will contain the data files, the gnuplot command files and the generated (by the plt files) postscript files respectively.
GnuPlotWriter(java.io.File rootFolder, java.lang.String outputFolderName)
          Creates a GnuPlotWriter, that will create in the specified folder the specified subfolders for the various gnuplot artifacts.

Constructor Detail

GnuPlotWriter

public GnuPlotWriter(java.io.File rootFolder)
Creates a GnuPlotWriter, that will create in the specified folder, subfolders "data", "plt", "eps", which will contain the data files, the gnuplot command files and the generated (by the plt files) postscript files respectively.

Parameters:
rootFolder - the folder in which the gnuplot artifacts will be created

GnuPlotWriter

public GnuPlotWriter(java.io.File rootFolder,
                     java.lang.String outputFolderName)
Creates a GnuPlotWriter, that will create in the specified folder the specified subfolders for the various gnuplot artifacts.

Parameters:
rootFolder - the folder in which the gnuplot artifacts will be created
outputFolderName - the subfolder name of the postscript files
Method Detail

writeDiagram

public void writeDiagram(Diagram diagram,
                         java.lang.String diagramName)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Writes a diagram with a specified name.

Parameters:
diagram - the diagram to render with gnuplot commands
diagramName - the name of the diagram-specific artifacts
Throws:
java.io.IOException - in case a IO failure occurs

writeDiagram

public GnuPlotWriter.GnuPlotFiles writeDiagram(Diagram diagram,
                                               java.lang.String diagramName,
                                               GnuPlotContext context)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Writes a diagram with a specified name, and a custom gnuplot context. The diagram must have one or two variables (i.e., diagram.getVariablesCount() should return 1 or 2). Diagrams with more variables are not supported.

Parameters:
diagram - the diagram to render with gnuplot commands
diagramName - the name of the diagram-specific artifacts
context - a custom context that can customize the gnuplot commands with extra settings and styles
Returns:
the files that are created
Throws:
java.io.IOException - in case a IO failure occurs

printDataFile

protected void printDataFile(java.io.File file,
                             Diagram diagram)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Writes into a file the data of a diagram, in an appropriate form to be read by gnuplot.

Parameters:
file - the output file to create
diagram - the diagram of which the data to write
Throws:
java.io.IOException

printCommandFile

protected void printCommandFile(java.io.File commandFile,
                                java.io.File outputFile,
                                java.io.File dataFile,
                                Diagram diagram,
                                GnuPlotContext context)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Writes the gnuplot command file that will generate the plot of a diagram.

Parameters:
commandFile - the gnuplot command file to create
outputFile - the target file in which to create the plot (for example, a postscript file)
dataFile - the file which contains the data which will be plotted
diagram - the diagram to be plotted
context - gnuplot settings used to customize the gnuplot output
Throws:
java.io.IOException

createMasterPlotFile

public java.io.File createMasterPlotFile(java.lang.String masterFilename)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Creates a file in the root folder of this writer, with commands directing gnuplot to execute all previously created diagram command files. Invoke this at the end of the diagram generation to get a single file with commands that will create all diagrams with gnuplot in one step.

Parameters:
masterFilename - the file (inside the root folder) to be created
Returns:
the file that was created
Throws:
java.io.IOException - in case a IO failure occurs
